etymologies: Middle English: from Old French tanesie, probably from medieval Latin athanasia ‘immortality’, from Greek

definitions: a plant of the daisy family with yellow flat-topped flower heads and aromatic leaves, formerly used in cooking and medicine.

notes.text: Genus Tanacetum, family Compositae: several species, in particular common tansy (T. vulgare)

shortDefinitions: plant of daisy family with yellow flat-topped flower heads and aromatic leaves
